acceptance: The demo includes a channel-loss scenario run and confirms that fallback parameters are applied within no more than 150 ms.
assumptions: Bench system time is synchronized; the main control loop frequency is 100 Hz.
conditions: The demo repository is loaded locally; operations are executed through the CookaReq CLI.
notes: Derived LLR without upward traceability: this constraint is introduced from fail-safe analysis and bench-specific characteristics.
rationale: Rationale: this requirement is derived from FMEA analysis of the telemetry channel and defines a local protective reaction. No direct SYS/HLR linkage is recorded because this is an implementation constraint of the subsystem.
source: Safety workshop notes, DEMO platform constraints
statement: The SENSOR_GUARD module shall activate the local fallback thrust-control profile within 150 ms after detecting invalidity of the input channel.
title: LLR-07 Local fallback on channel loss
